title: Key Points for Automobile Tire Inspection and Maintenance
content:
I. Tread Wear Indicator Check:
    1. Replace tires if tread depth is below 1.6mm.
    2. Observe whether wear is even.

II. Tire Pressure Check:
    1. Measure using a tire pressure gauge.
    2. Refer to the label on the door frame for cold tire pressure reference.

III. Other Considerations:
    1. Check for bulges or cracks on the tire sidewall.
    2. Perform regular tire rotation.

title: Record of Vibration Mark Issue Handling for Machine Tool No. 3
content:
I. Problem Description: Regular chatter marks appeared on the machined surface, and the surface finish failed to meet the required standard.
II. Solution: 1. Replace with a shorter tool holder; 2. Adjust cutting parameters (speed, feed rate).
III. Verification Result: After machining three consecutive parts, the chatter marks disappeared, and the Ra value met the standard.
IV. Personal Reflection: 1. Breaking down complex problems for verification improves efficiency; 2. The experience of mentors is valuable, but hands-on verification by oneself is indispensable.
summarized_info:
Yin Hao documented the handling record for the chatter marks issue on Machine Tool No. 3. The content includes:  
I. Problem Description: Regular chatter marks appeared on the machined surface, and the surface finish did not meet the standard.  
II. Solution: 1. Replace the tool holder with a shorter one; 2. Adjust cutting parameters (speed, feed rate).  
III. Verification Results: After machining three consecutive workpieces, the chatter marks disappeared, and the Ra value met the standard.

title: Review of Residential Issue Decision-Making
content:
In early May, the landlord, Ms. Li, informed us of her plan to sell the currently rented property, which may force us to relocate within a short period.

Analysis of Response Options:
1. Searching for a new rental: This involves high costs, complicated procedures, and significant uncertainty.
2. Negotiating a lease extension with the landlord: If the new owner agrees, stability can be maintained, though rent adjustments may occur.

Decision and Implementation:
After a week of comprehensive consideration, particularly factoring in commuting convenience and lifestyle needs, the decision was made to attempt negotiating a lease extension with the current landlord. On the evening of May 16, we clearly communicated to Ms. Li our intention to extend the lease for one year at the current rental rate. This approach best addresses the uncertainty caused by the landlord’s decision to sell the property.
summarized_info: In his notes, Yin Hao reviewed the housing issues caused by the landlord's decision to sell the property and the subsequent decision-making process, ultimately identifying the renewal of the lease as the chosen solution.

title: Rent Decision Analysis
content:
Evening of February 25, 2025  
Received a message from the landlord about the rent increase to 3,200 per month.  
Checked the Lianjia app: prices for similar units in the same residential complex range from 3,100 to 3,300 yuan, indicating the new rent aligns with market rates.  
Roughly calculated moving costs: agent fee (50% of monthly rent) + new security deposit (one month's rent) + moving truck expenses, with a one-time expenditure estimated to exceed 10,000 yuan.  
Comparison: renewing the lease would incur an additional 200 yuan per month, totaling 2,400 yuan per year; moving once would cost over 10,000 yuan, enough to cover several years of rent increase differences.  
Conclusion: From an economic perspective and considering savings plans (such as a down payment for a home), renewing the lease is the more pragmatic choice.
summarized_info: I have documented the analysis of rent increases and moving costs, concluding that renewing the lease is more cost-effective.

title: Machine Tool Failure Case: Transmission Shaft Machining Vibration
content: Problem: Sudden abnormal vibration of the drive shaft during the finishing stage. Root Cause: Improper parameter matching of the servo motor. Solution: Recalibrated the gain parameters, and the issue was resolved. Lesson Learned: Under similar operating conditions, the servo system response curve should be prioritized for inspection.
summarized_info: Before leaving work, Yin Hao meticulously documented a case of vibration failure in a machine tool transmission shaft, including the symptoms, causes, solutions, and lessons learned.

title: Study Notes for Lecture 2 of Electrical Engineering Fundamentals
content: "Fundamentals of Electrical Engineering" Lecture 2: Electrical Safety and Low-Voltage Electrical Equipment. Key Points: 1. Electrical safety operating procedures: power off, verification of de-energization, discharge, and grounding. 2. Wire color standards: yellow, green, red, blue. 3. Safety distance requirements: separation between high-voltage and low-voltage systems. 4. Five-step method for electric shock first aid: disconnect, assess, call for help, perform CPR, transport to hospital. 5. Low-voltage electrical equipment: symbols, structural principles, and selection of circuit breakers (QF), contactors (KM), and relays (KA). Simple diagrams should be drawn to enhance understanding.
summarized_info: Yin Hao recorded study notes for the second lecture of "Fundamentals of Electrical Engineering," covering electrical safety regulations, first aid methods, and the symbols and structures of low-voltage electrical devices.

title: Minutes of Technical Issue Resolution
content:
Regarding the recent issue of fluctuating hole diameter dimensions in parts, my approach is as follows:

1. **Data Recording and Analysis**: Detailed recording of key hole diameter measurements, along with simultaneous monitoring and documentation of machine tool operating time, part surface temperature, and spindle bearing housing temperature, to identify patterns in the data.

2. **Team Collaboration**: Immediate communication with Master Sun Jianguo regarding preliminary findings, followed by discussions with colleague Wang Lei and programmer Liu Zhiqiang to form a temporary collaborative team for joint analysis of potential causes.

3. **Systematic Troubleshooting Dimensions**: Planned and systematic investigation of multiple technical dimensions, including fixture clamping mechanisms, coolant pipelines, spindle radial runout, tool wear conditions, and program feed rates, through step-by-step checks and cross-validation until the root cause is identified.

Subsequently, the validated and effective optimization solutions must be updated into the standard operating procedures.
summarized_info: In his notes, Yin Hao systematically summarized the conventional approaches for addressing technical challenges such as "fluctuations in part aperture dimensions," including detailed data recording, proactive initiation of team collaboration, and systematic troubleshooting from multiple technical dimensions.

title: Key Points for DIY Oil and Oil Filter Change
content:
Notes from watching the video "Detailed Full Process of Changing Engine Oil and Oil Filter for a Family Car":
1. Tools: Wrench (14/17mm), oil filter cup wrench, oil drain pan, funnel, gloves, jack, safety stands (mandatory!).
2. Sequence: Jack up and secure the vehicle → warm up the engine and drain the oil → replace the oil filter (apply new oil to the seal, hand-tighten and then add an additional 3/4 turn) → refill with new oil → check oil level and for leaks.
3. Note: Dispose of used oil properly.
summarized_info: Yin Hao recorded a set of key operational points for changing engine oil and oil filters, derived from a specific tutorial video he watched.

title: Reflection and Adjustment of Financial Planning
content:
Evening of March 2, 2025  
After updating my March budget (with rent adjusted to 3,200), I couldn’t help but reflect on last week’s events. The water heater at Uncle Wang’s place next door suddenly broke down, leaking in the middle of the night, and he urgently needed funds to replace it. Unable to cover the expense immediately, he came to me for help, and I advanced him 3,000 yuan.  

This incident served as a wake-up call for me. Although my savings goal is for a down payment on a home, unexpected and unplanned expenses like this are always a risk in life. If I were to encounter a similar situation myself or needed to help family or friends, not having readily accessible funds would put me in a difficult position.  

Therefore, today I specifically opened my annual financial planning Excel template and, after the sections for "Monthly Fixed Expenses" and "Long-Term Savings," I added and emphasized a new planning category: "Emergency Reserve Fund." The goal is to gradually build up a dedicated fund equivalent to 3–6 months of living expenses by the end of this year. This fund will be kept separately in a highly liquid account and used only for emergencies. It should become a financial discipline as important as my savings goals.
summarized_info: I documented a reflection triggered by helping a neighbor cover repair costs and decided to emphasize the importance of establishing an emergency reserve fund in the financial template.

title: Postscript to the National Day Long-Distance Running Event
content: On October 4th, the planned long-distance training run was completed as scheduled. During the latter half of the run, the pace dropped noticeably, primarily due to persistent fatigue and stiffness in the posterior thigh and gluteal muscles. The left hamstring even felt somewhat strained. Key conclusion: Aerobic capacity is acceptable, but muscular strength and endurance are currently the limiting factors for long-distance performance, particularly in the posterior chain of the lower body. Strength training (especially squats, glute bridges, and hamstring curls) must be incorporated into the regular training plan at least twice a week; otherwise, it will be impossible to support goals of longer distances or faster paces.
summarized_info: Yin Hao documented experiencing muscle fatigue and decreased strength after a long-distance run on October 4, and plans to enhance strength training.

title: Today's Damage Review and Related Reflections
content: A high-intensity interval run just resulted in an ankle sprain. Direct cause analysis: To save time, the usual 15-minute dynamic warm-up was compressed to less than 5 minutes. Joints and muscles were not properly activated before increasing intensity, which was an extremely foolish and risky move. Deeper reflection: This is linked to the "strength deficiency" identified after the long-distance training session at the beginning of the month. Precisely because of the eagerness to compensate for the lack of strength (the conclusion from the previous reflection) and the desire to pursue faster paces during interval runs to "prove" progress, the warm-up was cut short, leading to today's injury. Two lessons must be bound together: 1. Before any training, a thorough warm-up is an ironclad rule; 2. Compensating for weaknesses (such as strength) requires scientific, progressive, and specialized training, not reckless attempts in other workouts. Therefore, all running is suspended for now to prioritize recovery, while planning a systematic introduction to strength training, starting with isometric exercises and light weights.
summarized_info: Yin Hao analyzed that the direct cause of the injury on October 15 was insufficient warm-up, and further reflected that this was related to the mindset of rushing to compensate for strength deficiencies after October 4. He reiterated the plan to suspend running and initiate rehabilitation and strength training.

title: Quick Overview of the Songjiang Rental Market
content:
Research Date: May 15th.  
Sector Comparison:  
1. Near University Town: Average price for a single room is 2,800–3,500 RMB, with a 30-minute commute.  
2. Along the New City Subway Line: One-bedroom apartment or master bedroom in a shared flat, 3,200–4,000 RMB, with a 20-minute commute.  
3. Old City Area: Lower prices but older housing.  
Moving Cost Assessment: Quotes from cross-district moving companies generally range from 600 to 1,000 RMB.  
Conclusion: If a similar rental unit can be renewed in the original or nearby community for no more than 3,200 RMB, it holds strong market competitiveness and should be prioritized. Otherwise, shared rental or relocation plans need to be initiated.
summarized_info: I have compiled a set of notes on the rental market research in Songjiang District, comparing rental prices and commuting conditions across different sub-districts, and evaluating the competitiveness of renewing the lease at 3,200 yuan.

title: Maintenance Key Points Record
content:
Consult Technician Chen at the service center regarding precautions for soldering a new capacitor:
- Confirm the capacitance and voltage rating of the old capacitor (the markings are faded and require measurement).
- Ensure the power is disconnected before soldering the new capacitor, and discharge it first.
- Use a soldering iron with appropriate power; the solder joints should be smooth and firm to avoid cold soldering.
- After soldering, check whether the fan rotates smoothly and without abnormal noise.
- Refer to the techniques for soldering wiring harnesses from previous automotive repair live streams, as the principles are similar.
summarized_info: Yin Hao documented some key maintenance points, which included precautions for welding new capacitors. He also mentioned consulting with Master Chen from the service center and referencing a previously watched live-streamed automotive repair session.

title: A Minor Jump-Start and the Inspiration from Casual Conversation
content: I went to Brother Wu's shop on Saturday morning. As soon as I arrived, I encountered a car owner seeking help at the entrance—his car wouldn't start. I determined it was a dead battery and used the jumper cables I always keep in my own car. Following the standard procedure of connecting positive to positive and grounding the negative, the car started successfully on the first try. The owner insisted on paying, but I declined. When Brother Wu finished his work and came out, having watched the whole process, he smiled and said, "You haven't forgotten everything you learned in the military, huh." His casual remark made me quite happy. It wasn't just about helping out; it felt more like recognition from a "fellow professional." Today, Brother Wu and I had a deeper conversation, ranging from fishing to our respective jobs. I realized that the closed-loop feedback in CNC machines, automotive circuit diagnostics, and even the "feel" he mentioned when repairing engines seem to share an underlying logic. They all involve using signals—whether electrical or mechanical feedback—to assess conditions and make adjustments. This idea is quite interesting and worth pondering.
summarized_info: In his notes, Yin Hao recorded his experience of successfully jump-starting a car for a stranger at Wu Ge Auto Repair Shop. He mentioned Wu Ge's praise that he "hadn't forgotten what he learned in the army," which led him to reflect on the underlying similarities between CNC skills and auto repair/electrical skills. He considered this idea worth pondering.

title: Honor of Kings Review and Improvement Plan
content: On the evening of April 5, 2025, I had a voice call with my friend Zhang Fei to review our recent consecutive losses. As a UI designer, Zhang Fei analyzed the situation from his professional perspective and suggested that our setbacks could not be entirely attributed to gameplay. He pointed out that, based on his observations of version update logs and personal experience, certain heroes (such as Jing) had undergone hidden adjustments (stealth nerfs) to their stats, which affected game balance. More importantly, he mentioned the underlying matchmaking algorithm mechanism of the game, which might contain systemic imbalances leading to poor match experiences. His analysis made me realize that victory or defeat depends not only on gameplay but also requires systematic research. Inspired by this, I have formulated the following systematic research plan: 1. Version-specific hero counter relationship chart; 2. Jungle rhythm and resource control; 3. Equipment and rune fine-tuning strategies; 4. Watching KPL and high-level match replays to learn macro strategies.
summarized_info: Recorded the content of reviewing consecutive game losses with Zhang Fei through voice communication. From the perspective of a UI designer, Zhang Fei analyzed issues related to the covert adjustments of heroes in the current version and the system's matchmaking mechanism, which prompted me to develop a systematic plan for game research.
